entry.title: User vote in blocksize through fees
entry.summary: The email thread discusses the issue of block size limit in Bitcoin. Jeff Garzik, a Bitcoin core developer, emphasizes the importance of increasing the block size limit as it defines the fee market and has direct economic consequences for miners. He argues that the decision should be transitioned away from software and developers to the free market. Mats Henricson responds by urging Garzik to make a suggestion or stay out of the debate, while Eric Lombrozo suggests the need for a voting system for metaconsensus but cautions against false choices. The email includes links to a block size change proposal and the Bitcoin-development mailing list.
